intro: Psychotria fernandopoensis, commonly known as the Madagascar psychotria, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to Madagascar. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in humid, tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves that are often glossy in appearance. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a small, smooth, yellowish drupe that contains a single seed.
